meanings.definition: To make something illegal by law.
meanings.sent1: The new law is criminalizing the possession of certain drugs.
meanings.sent2: The government is considering criminalizing texting while driving.
meanings.sent3: It would be quite criminalizing to ban ice cream on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent4: The strict dress code at the school is criminalizing individuality.
meanings.sent5: The sign clearly stated that parking in this area is criminalizing and subject to fines.

meanings.definition: To treat someone as a criminal.
meanings.sent1: The unfair treatment by the police was criminalizing the innocent man.
meanings.sent2: The media often criminalizes individuals without proper evidence.
meanings.sent3: It would be criminalizing to accuse someone of stealing without any proof.
meanings.sent4: The strict teacher was criminalizing the students for minor mistakes.
meanings.sent5: The harsh punishment was criminalizing the young offenders, making them feel hopeless.
